intro: Harveya huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén harveya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Harveya huillensis thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation to extreme climates.
